byline.original: By ANDREW MARTIN and PETER LATTMAN

abstract: A Connecticut woman will be allowed to name her line of skin care products after her daughter Willa. Procter & Gamble contended consumers would confuse the brand with its Wella hair care products.
snippet: A Connecticut woman will be allowed to name her line of skin care products after her daughter Willa. Procter & Gamble contended consumers would confuse the brand with its Wella hair care products.
lead_paragraph: A Connecticut mother and businesswoman has won the right to name her company after her daughter, Willa, despite the objections of the nation's largest consumer products company.

headline.main: Procter & Gamble Settles Trademark Dispute With Small Company
